pages.text: Tauraspis was a genus of osteostracan jawless fish that lived during the Early Devonian. The name "Tauraspis" means "bull shield", in reference to the strange, superficially horn-like bony protrusions on the front of its face. Its remains have been found in Severnaya Zemlya, Russia, and were first described in 1995. It seemingly lived in shallow waters.
